result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.

Consecutive to: eachother

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining Costs and DNA  to be paid as a Condition of Probation. $400 applied to Buy Money-PD IN FULL. $50.00 applied to Court costs.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - First 6 months straight time and last 2 months with Huber.
58 days credit granted toward Condition Time. Sentence may be served in Milwaukee County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel L Rogers in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea as to counts 2 and 3. State moves to strike the repeater allegations. Defense is requesting a sentencing date.  Court grants. Defendant will need OTP from Milwaukee County Jail.  Defendant can be returned forthwith.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel L Rogers in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco advises the Court that the purpose of the motion has been fulfilled and there is no longer necessary to address the motion.  The Court addresses the negative WCS report from February 26, 2016.  Attorney Bricco requests the Court not take any action on bail as the Defendant is set to enroll in treatment.  The State requests that the Court increase cash bail.  The Court orders the Defendant to remain compliant with the conditions of his bond and will not tolerate any further non compliance with WCS.  Bail remains as set.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
